overview_of_class: Evolutionary psychology addresses the ways that human behavior has been shaped by evolutionary pressures. The goal is to understand the origin and nature of adaptations to survival, sexual, and kin selection. Specific topics include the evolution of human mating, violence, altruism and morality, among others. Learning modalities include both lecture and discussion.
